result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Robert K Anderson in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

[MK] cases #22CF58 and #21CT668 called at 9:08am 
Defendant Robert K Anderson in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In Case #22CF58 Prelim-Waiver and Arraignment is held: 
Mr. Anderson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 9:12am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on June 22nd at 8:30am, (2) Status Conference on August 15th at 9:30am
Request from Department of Justice - Crime Information Bureau for Criminal Compliant and Bond. Response faxed on today's date - ML
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions of Bond:  
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

[MK] cases #21CT668 and #22CF58 called at 9:15am 
Defendant Robert K Anderson in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial Appearance is hed in Case #22CF58:  
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--Mr. Anderson verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  
--Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
--The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
